alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 09 at 3:04AM EDT until September 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk of rip currents and rough nearshore surf. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 1 AM EDT Saturday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/09 AM 4.7 1.9 1.7 2 MINOR 09/09 PM 4.9 2.1 1.6 2 MINOR 10/10 AM 4.3 1.5 1.2 1-2 NONE 10/10 PM 4.1 1.3 0.9 1 NONE 11/10 AM 4.0 1.2 0.8 1 NONE 11/11 PM 3.9 1.1 0.8 1 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 AM 4.7 1.8 1.5 4 NONE 09/08 PM 4.8 1.9 1.3 4 NONE 10/09 AM 4.3 1.4 0.9 3 NONE 10/09 PM 4.2 1.3 0.7 3 NONE 11/10 AM 4.2 1.3 0.7 2-3 NONE 11/10 PM 4.0 1.1 0.7 3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/09 AM 4.5 1.8 1.8 1 MINOR 09/09 PM 4.6 1.9 1.6 1 MINOR 10/10 AM 4.1 1.4 1.2 1 NONE 10/10 PM 3.9 1.2 0.9 1 NONE 11/10 AM 3.9 1.2 0.9 1 NONE 11/11 PM 3.8 1.1 0.9 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
